thread.title: Recap: Thousands join Manchester protest march at start of Tory party conference
thread.title_full: Recap: Thousands join Manchester protest march at start of Tory party conference - Mirror Online

author: Mikey Smith
title: Recap: Thousands join Manchester protest march at start of Tory party conference
text:
Thousands have taken to the streets of Manchester to protest outside the Tory Party conference today.
There are reports of confrontations outside the conference centre, as a mass of protesters march past shouting slogans.
Stay with us, we'll have all the latest as it unfolds.
Key Events So Far 1 hour ago Charlotte Church at protest rally 2 hours ago 60,000 march in Manchester 2 hours ago Young Tory egged by protesters 3 hours ago Taking no chances 3 hours ago Len McCluskey: Save Redcar Steel 16:46 Mikey Smith Recap That’s all for our live coverage of today’s protest in Manchester.
Here’s a recap of what went on at the march and rally from our reporter on the ground.
And stay with Mirror Politics for all the latest updates throughout the Tory party conference - we’ll bring you everything as it happens.
Jeremy Corbyn is expected to arrive in Manchester tomorrow, and will speak at a rally at 7pm.
There’s also an NHS protest due to kick off at 1pm on Tuesday.
Tory egged on by protestors at the Anti Austerity 16:27 Mikey Smith Junior doctors protest new contracts A group of junior doctors have taken to the stage to speak about the changes to contracts being forced through by Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt.
One doctor says he had to work 54 hours in 3 night shifts to look after all the patients in his hospital. “That does not seem very safe to me”
16:23 Dan Bloom Recap: 60,000 descend on Tory Conference in Manchester If you’ve just joined us, here’s a recap of what’s gone on so far.
Chants and horns filled the streets of Manchester as activists led a national demonstration against swingeing welfare cuts and the Trade Union Bill.
Basked in bright sunshine, marchers listened to speakers including singers Charlotte Church and Billy Bragg, who reworked song lyrics to include ‘take the money from Trident and spend it on the NHS’.
Read more from our reporter Dan Bloom here.
Protestors ahead of the first day of the Conservative Party Autumn Conference 2015 16:19 Mikey Smith Jeremy Corbyn can't be trusted because he wouldn't annihilate the human race Comedian Mark Steel’s up now with a rather jollier speech.
He jokes that “The people in there” don’t trust Jeremy Corbyn because “When he’s asked whether he’d press a button to annihilate the entire world, he won’t do it!”
16:15 Mikey Smith We rescue people, not banks The General Secretary of the Fire Brigade is up now.
Telling a story about a fireman in Italy who refused to cut the locks off the doors of an elderly woman who was being evicted.
It was the birth of a phrase which spread quickly through social media, which translates as “We rescue people, not banks.”
Fire Brigade Union gen sec is speaking now. http://t.co/QtPqN0DF3M
— Beth Abbit (@BethAbbit) Sun Oct 04 15:13:20 +0000 2015 16:11 Mikey Smith Owen Jones Professional Northerner Owen Jones opened by joking that he couldn’t help nudging in a link to the local area - he was born in Stockport, which is nearly Manchester.
Owen Jones is speaking and just got a huge round of applause. http://t.co/fFyOmBugTM
— Beth Abbit (@BethAbbit) Sun Oct 04 15:02:53 +0000 2015 16:06 Mikey Smith Dr Anas Tikriti: We will support no bullet in Syria Dr Anas Tikriti has been speaking at the rally.
He said “The real event in town is this, us. Not that decrepit event taking place in grand halls down the road.
“This government is not fit to govern. It’s defunct. Osborne is not fit to control the country’s public purse.
“This immorality goes beyond these borders. We will support no bullet in Syria, whatever country it comes from.
“We are here in support of those who need our help from those who government have washed their hands of because they cost us too much.”
Thanks to the Manchester Evening News
Dr Anas Tikriti says refugees will always be welcome here. He says: "We will accept not a single bullet to be fired into Syria."
— Beth Abbit (@BethAbbit) Sun Oct 04 14:53:24 +0000 2015 16:01 Mikey Smith Charlotte Church at protest rally Here’s some pictures of singer Charlotte Church, who appeared onstage at the anti-Tory rally this afternoon.
She gave a spirited speech, during which she had a pop at the media for giving Jeremy Corbyn a hard time for being an “extremist” while going easy on David Cameron - claiming there are “weird rituals and occultish initiations” going on behind the doors of Tory hotel rooms.
Charlotte Church takes part in an anti-austerity protest during the first day of the Conservative Party Autumn Conference Charlotte Church 15:59 Mikey Smith Jeremy Corbyn to attend Manchester rally tomorrow The Labour leader is to break with tradition and attend a rally outside the Tory conference tomorrow.
Dave Ward of CWC says Jeremy Corbyn will be in the city tomorrow.
— Beth Abbit (@BethAbbit) Sun Oct 04 14:57:14 +0000 2015 15:49 Mikey Smith 'This is the fight of our lives' From the Manchester Evening News
John Rees from the Stop the War Coalition is now speaking and is blasting zero hours contacts.
He says Tories give people no security.
Rees says he’s glad Corbyn is in to stop David Cameron bombing counties.
He adds: “This is the fight of our lives. Get in the streets and fight. Solidarity.”
John Rees stop the war coalition says #refugeeswelcome at #EndAusterityNow #No2Austerity demo http://t.co/oRv6UemzkP
— Stand Up To Racism (@AntiRacismDay) Sun Oct 04 13:43:45 +0000 2015 15:46 Mikey Smith Choir sing "Do one you Tory scum" In case you thought the last update was a joke, here’s evidence of the choir on the stage singing “Do one you Tory scum”
Women on stage sing 'do one you Tory scum' http://t.co/4SqzHN34ue
— Todd Fitzgerald (@TFitzgeraldMEN) Sun Oct 04 14:39:04 +0000 2015 15:37 Mikey Smith There now appears to be a choir on the stage singing a Montaverdi-esque round of “Do one you Tory scum.”
It’s probably the oddest thing we’ve seen all day. And there was a guy dressed as a gimp wearing a crown earlier, so that’s going some.
15:30 Mikey Smith Charlotte Church is optimistic More from Charlotte Church’s brief remarks from the MEN’s Todd Fitzgerald.
Church: "I've never felt so optimistic. They can hurt us, but we can fight back. Protest does work, has worked and will work for us now."
— Todd Fitzgerald (@TFitzgeraldMEN) Sun Oct 04 14:29:44 +0000 2015 15:29 Mikey Smith Charlotte Church is speaking at the rally Singer and activist Charlotte Church is giving a stirring speech at the closing rally.
She had a pop at the media for giving Jeremy Corbyn a hard time for being an “extremist” while going easy on David Cameron - claiming there are “weird rituals and occultish initiations” going on behind the doors of Tory hotel rooms.
15:19 Mikey Smith Natalie Bennett addresses the protest rally Green leader Natalie Bennett has been addressing the end-of-march rally in Manchester.
According to the MEN’s Todd Fitzgerald, she said: “We need real change...change is coming our way. The election of Jeremy Corbyn is just one sign. This is the politics of the people. We want a decent housing policy, for refugees to be welcome. We want decent benefits for people who need them. End benefit sanctions.
“We want trade unions to be able to act freely and properly. Free trade unions!”
She closed her comments by saying: “We are many, they are few. People power!”
@natalieben addresses the masses #TakeBackMCR #No2Austerity http://t.co/iIgAhGmmjn
— People's Assembly (@pplsassembly) Sun Oct 04 14:17:16 +0000 2015 DailyMirror
